title: How to Look Like Theda Bara

steps.headline: Choose clothing from Theda's era.
steps.description: As Theda lived a long time ago, it is not possible to know exactly what she wore when she was dressed casually. However, her formal wear still exists in pictures, where she is often shown wearing very loose low-necked, shapeless dresses. To emulate this, wear loose maxi dresses made from silk fabric or choose flowing dresses of any fabric type.

steps.headline: Wear a bright jewel-covered headband.
steps.description: Alternatively, use large and pretty tiaras. You can make your own jewel-covered headband by adding faux jewels to a classy headband.

steps.headline: Wear simple ballet shoes.
steps.description: Flat, dainty shoes are perfect. If you like heels, look for 1920s style heels, as they're quite different from those worn nowadays.

steps.headline: Wear heavy makeup that makes your skin look very white and smooth.
steps.description: Keep the appearance as smooth as possible, to minimize any wrinkles.

steps.headline: Put on a lot of eyeshadow.
steps.description: Spread it down a couple of centimeters under your eyes. Also keep your eyelashes thick and dark, and apply some mascara.

steps.headline: Wear your hair up in a bun or leave it out in a wild curly fashion.
Copy some of Theda's expressions.
steps.description: Theda usually had a deep wistful staring look. Get a picture of her and mimic her look in a mirror. Don't try to look like her, as this isn't about exact appearance; instead, seek to present the same expression, but in your own way.

steps.headline: Walk with style and stand with grace.
steps.description: Theda often walked around slowly in a seductive way.

text: Clothing, Shoes, and Accessories Choose clothing from Theda's era. As Theda lived a long time ago, it is not possible to know exactly what she wore when she was dressed casually. However, her formal wear still exists in pictures, where she is often shown wearing very loose low-necked, shapeless dresses. To emulate this, wear loose maxi dresses made from silk fabric or choose flowing dresses of any fabric type. Wear a bright jewel-covered headband. Alternatively, use large and pretty tiaras. You can make your own jewel-covered headband by adding faux jewels to a classy headband. Wear simple ballet shoes. Flat, dainty shoes are perfect. If you like heels, look for 1920s style heels, as they're quite different from those worn nowadays. Makeup Wear heavy makeup that makes your skin look very white and smooth. Keep the appearance as smooth as possible, to minimize any wrinkles. Put on a lot of eyeshadow. Spread it down a couple of centimeters under your eyes. Also keep your eyelashes thick and dark, and apply some mascara. Wear heavy dark red lipstick.  Wear your hair up in a bun or leave it out in a wild curly fashion.  Emulating Theda's Style Copy some of Theda's expressions. Theda usually had a deep wistful staring look. Get a picture of her and mimic her look in a mirror. Don't try to look like her, as this isn't about exact appearance; instead, seek to present the same expression, but in your own way. Walk with style and stand with grace. Theda often walked around slowly in a seductive way.
